segments.en: 6. Another Chapter of Abbreviated Texts on the Ganges, Etc.

segments.pli: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, gaṅgā nadī pācīnaninnā pācīnapoṇā pācīnapabbhārā;
segments.en: “Mendicants, the Ganges river slants, slopes, and inclines to the east.

segments.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañca balāni bhāvento pañca balāni bahulīkaronto nibbānaninno hoti nibbānapoṇo nibbānapabbhāro.
segments.en: In the same way, a mendicant who develops and cultivates the five powers slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañca balāni bhāvento pañca balāni bahulīkaronto nibbānaninno hoti nibbānapoṇo nibbānapabbhāro?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant who develops the five powers slant, slope, and incline to extinguishment?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu, saddhābalaṃ bhāveti rāgavinayapariyosānaṃ dosavinayapariyosānaṃ mohavinayapariyosānaṃ …
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant develops the powers of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom, which culminate in the removal of greed, hate, and delusion.

segments.pli: evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañca balāni bhāvento pañca balāni bahulīkaronto nibbānaninno hoti nibbānapoṇo nibbānapabbhāro”ti.
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant who develops and cultivates the five powers slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.”
(To be expanded for each of the different rivers as in SN 45.91–102, removal of greed version.)
Six on slanting to the east,
and six on slanting to the ocean;
and that’s how this chapter is recited.
